title: Sinner returns from doping ban at Italian Open
description: Jannik Sinner is returning from a doping ban at the Italian Open.

title: 'I have some gas left in the tank': At 37, Djokovic still has big tennis goals
description: Djokovic has had a rough start to 2025, but shown flashes of brilliance too. And he's aiming for that 100th tour win.
author: Simon Cambers

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let’s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: Watch Wawrinka on FREE Challenger TV
description: Less than two weeks removed from a runner-up finish at the ATP Challenger Tour 175 event in Aix-en-Provence, Stan Wawrinka will hope to go one step further in Bordeaux. The Swiss is competing at the BNP Paribas Primrose Bordeaux, where on Tuesday he will meet Billy Harris not before 8 p.m. local time. Fans can tune into Challenger TV to stream all ATP Challenger Tour matches live and on demand at no cost. At the Challenger 175 event in Turin, #NextGenATP teen and home hope Federico Cina will be in action against Argentine Juan Manuel Cerundolo. Eighth seed Alexander Bublik closes the day against and Italian Matteo Gigante. Watch Stan Wawrinka vs. Billy Harris in Bordeaux, France (not before 8 p.m. local time) Watch Matteo Gigante vs. Alexander Bublik in Turin, Italy (not before 7 p.m. local time) [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Tommy Paul's troublesome foe, why 'life's been pretty good' & two goals he's chasing
description: It all added up for Tommy Paul earlier this year when he cracked the Top 10 of the PIF ATP Rankings for the first time. Will he next achieve one of his biggest goals: claiming ATP Masters 1000 glory? The American is trying to do just that this week at the Internazionali BNL d'Italia, where he is into the fourth round. But to make the quarter-finals, Paul will need to overcome Alex de Minaur's 5-0 lead in their Lexus ATP Head2Head series. ATPTour.com caught up with Paul at Indian Wells to discuss why playing De Minaur is difficult, his greatest success, why he doesn't feel he has dealt with too many difficulties and plenty more. What is your favourite tennis rivalry? Rafa and Roger, it's my favourite rivalry in tennis. Who is your greatest rival? I don't know if it's a rivalry, because he's got me so many times, but me and Demon [Alex de Minaur] have had some serious wars, and he's got me in some big matches, so I'm out for revenge on Demon. What makes him so tough to play? Consistency. Doesn't miss a ball. He’s a dog on court. What has been your greatest success? I would say my greatest success so far is last year in Queen's [Club], winning the 500 title. That was a special thing at a special place.  What's the greatest difficulty you've had to overcome? I don't like to feel like I've had too many huge difficulties in my life. I play tennis for my job and for a living, and I think life's been pretty good. What's been the most unique moment in your career? Transitioning from juniors to pros is unique. I think for a lot of people it's easier than others and for me it was a difficult time, but definitely a big change in lifestyle. What is the biggest number or the biggest accomplishment that you're chasing? I guess the biggest thing that I'm chasing is a tournament, a Masters 1000 title or Top 5 in the world. How long have you been pursuing that? I guess my whole life. I feel like every time I go to a tournament, the goal is to win the tournament. And I played quite a few of these, and I've wanted to win every single one that I've played. What's your favourite tournament to play? My favourite tournament to play in is either Indian Wells, Wimbledon, or the US Open. US Open because it's the home slam for us. Wimbledon, it's the mecca. And Indian Wells, because [it is] tennis paradise.   What's been the coolest off-court experience you've been able to enjoy being a professional tennis player? I've gone to a lot of really cool sporting events, whether it's on the Tour or at home. I guess earlier this year, the Eagles won the Super Bowl, and I went to the NFC Championship game. That was a pretty awesome event to go to. Has being a professional tennis player given you some better fishing opportunities? Before the [US] Open, a couple years ago, we went fishing in the Hamptons, and that was quite an experience. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Raducanu's Rome run ended by classy Gauff
description: Emma Raducanu's encouraging Italian Open run ends in the last 16 as Coco Gauff proves too much of a step up in class.

title: Sinner through in Rome but tough test lies ahead
description: World number one Jannik Sinner continues his return from a doping ban with a comfortable 6-4 6-2 victory over Jesper de Jong to reach the last 16 of the Italian Open.

title: Italian Open 2025 Day 6 Recap
description: Day 6 of the Internazionali BNL d’Italia delivered a mix of dominant performances and an unfortunate injury as the Round of 32 concluded in Rome. Top seed Jannik Sinner continued his seamless return to the ATP Tour, while rising star Jakub Mensik solidified his credentials at the Masters 1000 level. Casper Ruud advanced via retirement, …
author: Jonathan

title: Italian Open 2025 Day 5 Recap
description: On Day Five at the Foro Italico, the bottom half of the draw played their round of 32 matches, and it was generally a solid day for the seeds. Third seed Carlos Alcaraz fought through a tight first set to beat Laslo Djere 7-6(2), 6-2 and reach the fourth round to join Zverev (2), Draper …
author: Jonathan
